alert.note: Alert for Haywood (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 29 at 3:09PM CST until December 29 at 6:45PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR HAYWOOD COUNTY... At 309 PM CST, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Brownsville with flooding on Main Street. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Brownsville, Belle Eagle, Holly Grove, Nutbush, Oakview, Christmasville, Sunnyhill, Allens, Rudolph, Tibbs, Owl City, Shepp, Jones, Edward Grove and Turnpike. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
